sections.heading: 01|Fiduciary defined.Effective:October 12, 2016Latest Legislation:House Bill 158 - 131st General AssemblyPDF:Download Authenticated PDF"Fiduciary," as used in Chapters 2101
sections.text: to 2131. of the Revised Code, means any person, other than an assignee or trustee for an insolvent debtor or a guardian under

sections.heading: 37,2109.371, and2109.372of  the Revised Code do not prohibit a fiduciary from retaining any  part of a trust estate as received by the fiduciary even though  that part is not of the class or percentage permitted to  fiduciaries, or from retaining any investment made by the  fiduciary after the inves
sections.text: 37,2109.371, and2109.372of the Revised Code do not prohibit a fiduciary from retaining any part of a trust estate as received by the fiduciary even though that part is not of the class or percentage permitted to fiduciaries, or from retaining any investment made by the fiduciary after the investment ceases to be of a class or exceeds the percentage permitted by law, provided the circumstances are not such as to require the fiduciary to dispose of the investment in the performance of the fiduciary's duties.
